snippet: In an effort to protect its wealth of resources, Brazil is increasing its military presence along the Amazon borders near Venezuela, Suriname, French Guiana and Guyana.
abstract: Brazil deploys more than 8,500 troops to the far reaches of the Amazon rain forest in an operation aimed at cracking down on drug smuggling, gold mining and illegal deforestation; growing military presence is part of country's plan to assert greater control over its wealth of resources along the Amazon borders near Venezuela, Suriname, French Guiana and Guyana.
lead_paragraph: In an effort to protect its wealth of resources, Brazil is increasing its military presence along the Amazon borders near Venezuela, Suriname, French Guiana and Guyana.

headline.seo: Brazil Sending Troops to Guard Amazon Borders
headline.main: Brazil Sending More Troops to Guard Amazon Borders
headline.print_headline: Brazil Increasing Military Presence Along Amazon Borders
